data.type: preallocate files fast, using operating system functionality. on posix systems, posix_fallocate system call is used. automatically set to

data.name: innodb_use_global_flush_log_at_trx_commit
data.type: determines whether a user can set the variable

data.name: innodb_use_mtflush
data.type:
whether to enable multi-threaded flush operations.
for more information, see fusion.  this feature was deprecated in version 10.2.9 and removed from version 10.3.2 of mariadb.  instead, use

data.name: innodb_use_native_aio
data.type: for linux systems only, specified whether to use linux's asynchronous i/o subsystem. set to

data.name: innodb_use_purge_thread
data.type: usually with innodb, data changed by a transaction is written to an undo space to permit read consistency, and freed when the transaction is complete. many, or large, transactions, can cause the main tablespace to grow dramatically, reducing performance. this option, introduced in xtradb 5.1 and removed for 5.5, allows multiple threads to perform the purging, resulting in slower, but much more stable performance.

data.name: innodb_use_stacktrace
data.type: if set to

data.name: innodb_use_sys_malloc
data.type: if set the

data.name: innodb_use_sys_stats_table
data.type: if set to

data.name: innodb_use_trim
data.type: use trim to free up space of compressed blocks. see

data.name: innodb_version
data.type: innodb version number. from

data.name: innodb_write_io_threads
data.type: number of i/o threads for xtradb/innodb writes. you may on rare occasions need to reduce this default on linux systems running multiple mariadb servers to avoid exceeding system limits.
